description: Manage application-level routing and load balancing services.

commands.name: az network application-gateway create
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway create --name
                                      --resource-group
                                      [--capacity]
                                      [--cert-file]
                                      [--cert-password]
                                      [--connection-draining-timeout]
                                      [--custom-error-pages]
                                      [--enable-private-link]
                                      [--frontend-port]
                                      [--http-settings-cookie-based-affinity {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                      [--http-settings-port]
                                      [--http-settings-protocol {Http, Https, Tcp, Tls}]
                                      [--http2 {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                      [--identity]
                                      [--key-vault-secret-id]
                                      [--location]
                                      [--max-capacity]
                                      [--min-capacity]
                                      [--no-wait]
                                      [--priority]
                                      [--private-ip-address]
                                      [--private-link-ip-address]
                                      [--private-link-primary {false, true}]
                                      [--private-link-subnet]
                                      [--private-link-subnet-prefix]
                                      [--public-ip-address]
                                      [--public-ip-address-allocation]
                                      [--routing-rule-type {Basic, PathBasedRouting}]
                                      [--servers]
                                      [--sku {Standard_Medium, Standard_Small, Standard_v2, WAF_Large, WAF_Medium, WAF_v2}]
                                      [--ssl-certificate-name]
                                      [--ssl-profile]
                                      [--ssl-profile-id]
                                      [--subnet]
                                      [--subnet-address-prefix]
                                      [--tags]
                                      [--trusted-client-cert]
                                      [--validate]
                                      [--vnet-address-prefix]
                                      [--vnet-name]
                                      [--waf-policy]
                                      [--zones]
examples: az network application-gateway create --capacity 2 --frontend-port MyFrontendPort --http-settings-cookie-based-affinity Enabled --http-settings-port 80 --http-settings-protocol Http --location westus2 --name MyAppGateway --public-ip-address MyAppGatewayPublicIp --resource-group MyResourceGroup --sku Standard_Small --subnet MySubnet --vnet-name MyVNet

az network application-gateway create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway --capacity 2 --sku Standard_Medium --vnet-name MyVNet --subnet MySubnet --http-settings-cookie-based-affinity Enabled --public-ip-address MyAppGatewayPublicIp --servers 10.0.0.4 10.0.0.5

az network application-gateway create -n MyAppGateway -g MyResourceGroup --public-ip-address MyPublicIP --sku Standard_v2 --priority 1001 --ssl-profile name=MyProfile min-protocol-version=TLSv1_0 cipher-suites=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256 policy-type=Custom client-auth-configuration=True

commands.name: az network application-gateway delete
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway delete [--ids]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--subscription]
examples: az network application-gateway delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway

commands.name: az network application-gateway show
commands.summary: Get the details of an application gateway.
examples: az network application-gateway show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway

commands.name: az network application-gateway show-backend-health
commands.summary: Get information on the backend health of an application gateway.
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway show-backend-health [--address-pool]
                                                   [--expand]
                                                   [--host]
                                                   [--host-name-from-http-settings {false, true}]
                                                   [--http-settings]
                                                   [--ids]
                                                   [--match-body]
                                                   [--match-status-codes]
                                                   [--name]
                                                   [--path]
                                                   [--protocol {Http, Https, Tcp, Tls}]
                                                   [--resource-group]
                                                   [--subscription]
                                                   [--timeout]
examples: az network application-gateway show-backend-health -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway

az network application-gateway show-backend-health -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway --host-name-from-http-settings --path /test --timeout 100 --http-settings appGatewayBackendHttpSettings --address-pool appGatewayBackendPool

commands.name: az network application-gateway start
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway start [--ids]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--subscription]
examples: az network application-gateway start -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway

commands.name: az network application-gateway stop
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway stop [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az network application-gateway stop -g MyResourceGroup -n MyAppGateway

commands.name: az network application-gateway update
commands.syntax:
az network application-gateway update [--add]
                                      [--capacity]
                                      [--custom-error-pages]
                                      [--family {Generation_1, Generation_2}]
                                      [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--http2 {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                      [--identity]
                                      [--ids]
                                      [--max-capacity]
                                      [--min-capacity]
                                      [--name]
                                      [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                      [--remove]
                                      [--resource-group]
                                      [--set]
                                      [--sku {Basic, Standard_Large, Standard_Medium, Standard_Small, Standard_v2, WAF_Large, WAF_Medium, WAF_v2}]
                                      [--ssl-profiles]
                                      [--subscription]
                                      [--tags]
examples: az network application-gateway update --name MyApplicationGateway --resource-group MyResourceGroup --set sku.tier=WAF_v2

commands.name: az network application-gateway wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
